User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user in the Cosmic Scriptures Explorer application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user, matching the Firebase Auth UID.

role.description: The user's role within the application.

verified.description: Indicates whether the user's email has been verified.

kycStatus.description: The user's KYC (Know Your Customer) status.

createdVoices.description: A list of voice IDs created by the user.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the user account was created.

category.description: Category of the scripture (Ancient Scriptures, Regional Texts, Philosophical Works).

era.description: Era in which the scripture was written (Satya, Treta, Dvapara, Kali).

summary.description: Concise summary of the scripture content.

Project.title: Project
Project.description: Represents a voice or audio project created by a user.

ownerUid.description: The UID of the user who owns the project.

inputText.description: The source text for the project.

inputLanguage.description: The language of the source text.

targetLanguage.description: The target language for translation or speech synthesis.

voiceId.description: The ID of the voice model used for the project.

status.description: The current status of the project.

outputUrl.description: The URL to the generated audio or video file.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the project was created.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the project was last updated.

Voice.title: Voice
Voice.description: Represents a user-created voice model for TTS.

ownerUid.description: The UID of the user who owns the voice model.

sampleUrl.description: URL to the audio sample used for cloning.

embeddingVector.description: A reference or serialized representation of the voice embedding vector.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the voice model was created.

AppConfig.title: AppConfig
AppConfig.description: Represents a global application configuration document.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to manage users and scriptures within the Cosmic Scriptures Explorer application. User data is stored in a dedicated `users` collection, with each document representing a user. This ensures path-based ownership and simplifies security rules for user-specific data. Scripture data is stored in a `scriptures` collection, facilitating easy querying and management of scripture entries. The 'projects' collection stores user-generated content with strict ownership rules. The 'voices' collection stores sensitive voice model data, with strict ownership and KYC-based creation rules. The 'appConfig' collection stores global settings that are publicly readable but not client-writable. This structure avoids hierarchical authorization dependencies, improving security rule simplicity and debuggability. It also supports robust `list` operations for scriptures, as all documents in the `scriptures` collection share the same security requirements.

/users/{userId}.description: Stores user profiles. Path-based ownership enables simple security rules based on `request.auth.uid`. The 'userId' parameter is the Firebase Authentication UID.

/scriptures/{scriptureId}.description: Stores scripture entries. Each document represents a scripture. Supports secure list operations due to homogeneous security posture.

/projects/{projectId}.description: Stores voice and audio projects created by users. Path-based ownership ensures users can only access their own projects.

/voices/{voiceId}.description: Stores user-generated voice models. Path-based ownership ensures users can only access their own voice data. Creation is restricted to KYC-verified users.

/appConfig/{configId}.description: Stores global application settings. These documents are publicly readable but only writable by admins.
